result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnya M Goetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
After 15 months eligible for challenge and early release programs.
If doesn't receive treatment in prison, then must complete AODA assessement/treatment; and, if has substance abuse treatment in prison, then follow through with aftercare treatment while on Extended Supervision.  
No contact with co-defendant's Leah Luedtke, and Chad Wampole.  
No contact with  Jahn Tinglum, unless approved by Agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment until restitution is paid, if paid then can be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay Joint/Several restitution on the readins of $1,618.92, and $1,343.44.

Pay cost, VW, filing fees, DNA surcharges for all three counts.  
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with Attorney (Atty) Shari L Post. Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:01 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This matter is scheduled for a termination hearing today. This was continued from last week due to the fact that Atty Post was just appointed and didn't have time to review the records or discuss with her client.

Court did not participate in the team decision to terminate Defendant from treatment court. This decision/vote was taken in the Court's absence for the Court to remain neutral for due process.
Parties are prepared to proceed.

9:03 M.S. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Mukoski.

19CF-133 Outagamie County case is referred to. Court takes Judicial notice of this file.

State has no further witnesses.

Direct examination by Atty Post.
9:34 AM Examination by the Court.

Atty Mukoski addresses the Court, makes closing remarks.
Atty Post addresses the Court, makes closing remarks.
Defendant addresses the Court, makes closing remarks.

Court has a number of factors and concerns to consider to make decision.

BY THE COURT:
Court upholds the decision of the treatment court team and enters an order that Defendant be terminated from treatment court at this time.
Hearing on April 5, 2019 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with Attorney (Atty) Shari L Post. Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

records.addlTxt:
AND EXHIBIT:
Exhibit #P1 Original letter from Portage County Sheriff's Dept. with a copy of letter from Shawnya Goetz

1:45 p.m. Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI Report.  No corrections needed.  State says victim(s) were notified. Court notes no victims present.  Exhibit P#1 is marked and referred to during statements made by ADA Constable for the Court to review.  Atty Renc also received copy of same exhibit be reviewed by the Court.

State recommends: 
Count 1: Prison Sentence: 1 yr In & 1 yr ES, concurrent to any other sentence serving:  Conditions: No contact with co-defendant's Jahn Tinglum, Leah Luedtke, and Chad Wampole.    Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time. Pay court costs on each count.   25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Comply with all other treatment/programs as recommended by her Agent.
Count 3: Prison Sentence: 2 yrs In & 2 yrs ES, concurrent.
Count 5: Prison Sentence: 1 yr In & 1 Yr ES, concurrent.

Atty Renc states she calculated 159 days credit and requests the same sentence as the Co-Defendant Jahn Tinglum I/S Sentence of prison, but be placed on Probation.  Requests contact with Jahn Tinglum since it is a long term relationship.
Defendant makes statements of wanting to get treatment.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:  Prison Sentence: 1 yr In & 1 yr ES, concurrent to any other sentence serving:  
ES Conditions: After 15 months eligible for challenge and early release.  159 days credit.
Pay Joint/Several restitution on the readins of $1,618.92, and $1,343.44.  
Pay cost, VW, filing fees, DNA surcharges for all three counts.  25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
If doesn't receive treatment in prison, then must complete AODA assessement/treatment; and, if has substance abuse treatment in prison, then follow through with aftercare treatment while on Extended Supervision.  
No contact with co-defendant's Leah Luedtke, and Chad Wampole.  
No contact with  Jahn Tinglum, unless approved by Agent. Obtain and maintain full-time employment until restitution is paid, if paid then can be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time. 

Count 3: Prison Sentence: 2 yrs In & 2 yrs ES, concurrent with one another. Pay cost, VW, filing fees, DNA surcharges. Same conditions.
Count 5: Prison Sentence: 1 yr In & 1 Yr ES, concurrent with one another. Pay cost, VW, filing fees, DNA surcharges. Same conditions.

Cash Bond of $2,500 is reinstated. No contact with any Walmart or co-defendants
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Report to Day Report drug/alcohol free on all Court dates

FTR: 1:16:00

State requests a cash bond of $2,500.00.
Court notes that the Defendant was present and told when the prior court date was on 12-19-14 for a sentencing hearing.

BTC: Cash Bond of $2,500 is reinstated. No contact with any Walmart or co-defendants

Report to Day Report drug/alcohol free on all Court dates

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF76, 14CF143, 14CF144

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court questions if the defendant has served 111 days in jail already. 
Atty Renc indicates defendant has other pending charges which will keep her in custody in Marathon County.  Makes additional statements to the Court.  They are prepared to go to sentencing today.  Defendant is on a signature bond for these cases.  

Defendant enters a plea to 14CF76 Counts 1, 3 and 5 -  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF76 Counts 1, 3 & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and Read-in are the following:  14CF143, 14CF144, 14CF76 Counts 2 & 4. 
Court orders a PSI. 
Court notes there are cash bonds in all files. 

Atty Renc notes there was a motion to modify to signature bonds, questions if the hearing took place. 
Court reviews the file.  The $2,500 cash bond was amended to a $2,500 signature bond in 14CF76. In 14CF143 & 14CF144 were modified to $1,000 signature bonds. 

BY THE COURT: 
PSI to be completed by 12/3/14 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 08:45 am.
